N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1802.4 - Designation of sponsors

State Regulations
(a) Except
in the case of a limited profit housing company or a limited dividend housing
company organized under the provisions of articles 2 and 4, respectively, of
the Private Housing Finance Law, the agency may designate one or more sponsors
as "qualified and eligible". A designation shall not carry with it any
preference. If only one sponsor is designated for the whole project, or for a
particular parcel, publication of notice of availability of Redeveloper's

Statement for Public Disclosure shall precede approval of the designation by
the governing body. (b) In addition
to sponsors designated by the agency as qualified and eligible, the governing
body may submit the names of other interested sponsors to the agency for its
determination as to whether they are qualified and eligible. (c) The governing body may thereafter proceed
to approve the designated sponsor as qualified and eligible, by ordinance or
resolution. The governing body may not approve a sponsor not designated as
qualified and eligible by the agency. (d) Such "designation" or approval may take
place at any time after the approval of the urban renewal plan by the planning
commission and the governing body, establishment of the "rules and procedures", and filing such rules and procedures with the commissioner, without regard to
whether or not acquisition has yet taken place. Notes
